channel.title: Having an issue with my Kick command

item.title: Having an issue with my Kick command
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

You’re not disconnecting anyone… You’re just sending the message that the player has been kicked.

You need to make it disconnect the player, here’s an example that won’t work for you but will give you an idea.

String name = command.substring(5);
Player other = getPlayer(name); //loops through the players online and retrieves the player specified

other.disconnected = true;
sendMessage(name +" has been kicked.");

Read full topic
item.source: Having an issue with my Kick command

item.title: Having an issue with my Kick command
item.dc:creator: @Donald8274 Donald8274
item.description:
@Donald8274 wrote:

Hello, I have been trying to get my kick code to work for about an hour trying multiple things but nothing seems to make it work. Here’s what I have at the moment.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("kick")) { PlayerHandler.kickNick = command.substring(5); sendMessage("You have kicked "+command.substring(5)); System.out.println("Admin "+playerName+" is kicking "+command.substring(5)+"."); }

I currently do not have any playerRights set up for it because I thought maybe it was conflicting with something. I’ll add the rights again later. Please, if you have any idea why this isn’t working, help me fix it. Thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Having an issue with my Kick command
